meanings.definition: The quality or state of being separable.
meanings.sent1: The separability of the puzzle pieces made it easy for the child to put them together.
meanings.sent2: The separability of the ingredients allowed for easy customization of the dish.
meanings.sent3: The separability of the socks led to a funny mix-up in the laundry.
meanings.sent4: The separability of the colors in the painting created a striking contrast.
meanings.sent5: The separability of the keys on the ring made it convenient to use each one separately.

meanings.definition: The ability to be separated or divided.
meanings.sent1: The separability of the sections in the document made it easier to analyze.
meanings.sent2: The separability of the tasks allowed the team to work efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The separability of the flavors in the dish surprised the chef.
meanings.sent4: The separability of the layers in the rock revealed its history.
meanings.sent5: The separability of the threads in the fabric made it easier to mend.
